title: Dichotomy of Control
answer: Focus only on what is within your control: your judgments, intentions, and actions. Release concern over outcomes and other people’s opinions.
steps: List the parts of this problem you can control vs. cannot.
Commit to one controllable action today.
Journal how you felt after acting on what you control.
resources: Practice: Evening reflection on actions and judgments.

title: Present Moment Discipline
answer: Bring attention back to the present duty. The present is where virtue is practiced and peace is possible.
steps: Breathe and reset for 5 minutes; repeat.

title: Negative Visualization
answer: Imagine setbacks briefly to train gratitude and resilience. When adversity arrives, you won’t be surprised—you’ll be prepared.
steps: Spend 2 minutes imagining a mild setback.
Note one thing you appreciate right now.

title: Virtue First
answer: Let virtue (wisdom, courage, justice, temperance) guide choices. Meaning emerges when actions align with these virtues.
steps: Pick one virtue to emphasize today.
Define one action that expresses it.
Review at night: how did you practice it?

title: General
answer: Return to what is in your control, act with calm courage, and accept outcomes. Begin with a small, virtuous action now.
